transportAdvice: Cardiff city centre is compact and walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot. An extensive bus network and regular train services connect the city and surrounding areas, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and frequently wet with overcast skies, typical of a Welsh winter.
Similar to January, cold and damp with occasional frost and grey skies.
Early spring brings slightly milder temperatures but rain remains common.
Pleasantly mild with longer days and occasional sunny spells between showers.
One of the more agreeable months with warming temperatures and a mix of sun and cloud.
Warm and generally pleasant, though showers are still a regular occurrence.
The warmest month of the year with long daylight hours and a reasonable chance of sunshine.
Warm summer conditions continue, though rain can interrupt otherwise pleasant days.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings but still comfortable daytime temperatures.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn sets in, with frequent overcast days.
Cold and rainy with short daylight hours and a distinctly wintry feel.
Cold and damp throughout, with occasional frost and festive atmosphere in the city centre.
